item.title: Get Started with Keyple-Java
item.description: This getting stated contains one ready-to-execute JAVA example starting from a new Gradle project. The example demonstrate Keyple capabilities with the Keyple PCSC plugin and PO/SAM provided in the Calypso Test Kit.

item.title: Keyple ‘Core’ – User guide (high level API)
item.description: This high-level API is convenient for developers implementing smart card processing application for terminal interfaced with smart card readers. Packages & features The Keyple Core User API is a tool to manage readers, and to select “generic” Secure Elements.

item.title: Keyple Calypso – User guide (high level API)
item.description: Packages & features The Keyple Calypso User API is an extension of the Keyple Core User API to manage Calypso Portable Object securely using Calypso SAM: The generic Secure Element selection is enhanced for the selection of a Calypso PO.

item.title: First Meet Up Eclipse Keyple
item.description: On October 17, 2019, we organized the first Meet Up Eclipse Keyple! Great moments of exchanges around the first Open Source SDK for Ticketing with Benoît Boute, Nicolas Generali, Pierre Terree, Hicham ELBIZY, Benoist Laforge, Gaël Blondelle, Camille Moulin, Philippe Vappereau, Valentina Zajackowski.

item.title: Log parser
item.description: Copy/Paste your raw log data here (DEBUG level) and press the parse button: Parse Show raw data Generate stub commands code The transaction trace: APDU exchanges Step Target Command/Action
